FuncDef:
The ospf frr block multi-area command blocks FRR on a specified OSPF multi-area adjacency interface.
The undo ospf frr block multi-area command restores the default configuration. The ospf frr block multi-area command blocks FRR on a specified OSPF multi-area adjacency interface. The undo ospf frr block multi-area command restores the default configuration. By default, FRR is not blocked on a multi-area adjacency interface.
ParentView: 100GE interface view,10GE interface view,200GE interface view,25GE sub-interface view,25GE interface view,400GE interface view,50GE sub-interface view,50GE interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view,Tunnel interface view,VBDIF interface view,VLANIF interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an OSPF area. The value is an integer.
The value is a decimal integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the ID of an OSPF area, in the format of an IP address.
The value is in the format X.X.X.X, where each X represents a value from 0 to 255

ExtraInfo: You can run the ospf frr block multi-area command on a device that transmits important services to prevent the device from becoming a node on the backup link. This prevents services from being affected after FRR calculation.
